actions.name: Create Jira ticket
actions.description: Creates a Jira ticket based on newly opened GitHub issues, syncing relevant information such as the issue title and number. It utilizes a GitHub Action to facilitate the transfer of data from GitHub to Jira, ensuring that issues are tracked in both systems.

actions.name: Sync board list
actions.description: Updates the board JSON in the armbian/armbian.github.io repository by sending a repository dispatch event. It specifically targets changes made to board configuration files in the main branch.
actions.execution_method: push to main branch with changes in config/boards/*.*

actions.name: Sync labels
actions.description: Syncs labels from a YAML file to issues and pull requests based on modifications. Applies labels according to the specified configuration in '.github/labels.yml'. Executes a dry run for pull requests to preview changes before applying them.

actions.name: Sync maintainers
actions.description: Syncs maintainers' information from a contacts database to board configuration files, updating the BOARD_MAINTAINER property. If changes are detected, it creates a Pull Request to reflect these updates. The process includes downloading a JSON file, parsing it, and modifying configuration files accordingly.

actions.name: Sync tools
actions.description: Updates versions of specified tools in scripts by checking the latest releases from their respective repositories and creating a pull request if an update is necessary. This workflow acts as a self-created dependabot for tools that cannot be updated by standard methods. New tools can be added easily by modifying the matrix configuration.
actions.cron_schedule: at 42 minutes past the hour, at 3:00, on day 16

actions.name: Dispatch to fork
actions.description: Dispatches events to a forked repository based on various GitHub events. It sends a repository dispatch event with details about the current event, including references and SHA. The dispatch occurs only if the repository is a fork and a specific secret is set.

actions.name: Mirror to Codeberg
actions.description: Pushes the contents of the repository to the Codeberg mirror, ensuring that the latest changes are reflected in the external repository. It checks out the full history of the repository before mirroring to maintain complete commit history.

actions.name: Announce merge
actions.description: Announces merges to the main branch by sending a message to Discord with details about the merge, including the repository, actor, and commit message.

actions.name: Announce PR
actions.description: Announces pull requests on Discord for review when labeled with a specific label. It sends a message containing the pull request details, including the repository, author, and a link to the pull request. This facilitates communication and review among team members.

actions.name: Auto-label PR
actions.description: Automatically labels pull requests based on size, file categories, and creation date, while also removing the 'Ready to merge' label on updates. It categorizes PRs using a predefined configuration and assigns size labels based on the number of changed lines. Additionally, it tracks PRs quarterly by assigning labels corresponding to the creation month.

actions.name: Build artifacts
actions.description: Generates build artifacts for pull requests labeled with 'Build' by authorized members of the 'Release manager' team. It checks user membership before proceeding to compile the artifacts, ensuring only eligible contributors can trigger the build process.

actions.name: Check board assets
actions.description: Verifies assets for newly added board configurations in pull requests by checking for the existence of required board images and vendor logos in a specified repository. It generates a comment listing any missing assets and provides instructions for resolution. The workflow ensures that all necessary files are present for proper display in the Armbian Imager.

actions.name: Analyze kernel security
actions.description: Analyzes Linux kernel security options against hardening standards. Checks kernel configuration files for security issues and summarizes findings in the GitHub Actions job summary. Excludes RISC-V configurations due to lack of support.

actions.name: Clean workflow logs
actions.description: Cleans up workflow logs by deleting runs older than a specified number of days. It can be executed on a schedule or manually with input parameters to define the age of logs to delete and how many runs to retain.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on Mon

actions.name: Label PR on approval
actions.description: Labels pull requests as 'Ready to merge' upon approval and removes review-related labels. Downloads the pull request number from a previous workflow run and uses it to apply the label and manage other labels accordingly. Ensures that the label is only applied if the previous workflow concluded successfully.

actions.name: Lint scripts
actions.description: Runs ShellCheck on all scripts to analyze shell script quality and generate a report as a build artifact. It checks for errors in changed files within specific directories while ignoring certain file types. The process ensures that scripts are compliant with best practices and identifies potential issues.

actions.name: Listen PR review
actions.description: Saves the pull request number when a review is approved and uploads it as an artifact.

actions.name: Rewrite kernel configs
actions.description: Builds a dynamic matrix of kernel configurations and rewrites them based on an inventory of boards. Collects changes and aggregates them into a single pull request, summarizing modifications to Linux kernel config fragments across multiple boards and families. Ensures only relevant changes are included and provides a detailed summary of the modifications made.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on MON

actions.name: Rewrite patches
actions.description: Rewrites kernel or U-Boot patches for a specified board and branch, updating the repository and compiling changes. It checks for modifications, generates a pull request if changes are detected, and provides a summary of the changes made. Temporary files are cleaned up after the process completes.

actions.name: Security scan
actions.description: Runs security scans using Scorecards to analyze the repository's security posture and uploads the results to GitHub's code scanning dashboard. Publishes results for public repositories and optionally uploads the results as artifacts. The analysis is performed on the default branch and scheduled weekly.
actions.cron_schedule: at 30 minutes past the hour, at 1:00, on Sat

actions.name: Watchdog
actions.description: Monitors and reruns failed jobs for specified workflows, ensuring stability in CI/CD processes. It checks the latest run status and triggers a rerun if the previous attempt failed and hasn't exceeded the maximum retry limit. This helps maintain the reliability of automated workflows.

actions.name: Welcome first-time issue contributor
actions.description: Welcomes first-time issue contributors by sending a personalized message and labeling the issue as 'Good first issue'. It enhances community engagement by encouraging contributors to stay informed and support the project. The message expresses gratitude and provides a link for sharing contact preferences.

actions.name: Welcome first-time PR contributor
actions.description: Welcomes first-time contributors by posting a personalized message on their pull request. It expresses gratitude for their contribution and encourages further engagement with the project community. The message includes a link for sharing contact preferences and a reminder to star the repository.
